intro: Pentanisia ouranogyne, commonly known as the mountain lily, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are often short and sturdy. The flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
